result.execSummary:
The defendant Baldemar Barrientos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work and counseling he may be involved in

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs/surcharges
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
*Bond monies to be applied to fine/costs - balance to be paid while on probation
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol.
*No abusive contact with Margaret Sosa

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Baldemar Barrientos

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Baldemar Barrientos in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter, Enrique Soria, appears on behalf of the defendant.
Clerk gives Oath of Interpreter to Enrique Soria.

9:49 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest  

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

State complied with victim notification; the victim does not appear in Court today.
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay a 60 day jail sentence with huber privileges granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work and any counseling he may be involved in 
Placed on Probation for 12 months.
***Conditions of Probation: 
*Pay $50 fine plus costs and surcharges - victim witness surcharge, filing fee, DNA Surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*No abusive contact with Margaret Sosa 

**Bond monies to be applied to fine/costs - balance to be paid while on probation 
20 days to appeal
Plea hearing at 02-16-2016 09:30 am - Interpreter will be present.

Defendant Baldemar Barrientos in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:57 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances
Atty Cousins states that an interpreter is needed for the defendant.
This request had been made on the Pre-Trial Conference Data Sheet but had not been requested.

BY THE COURT:
Case to be re-scheduled.
  Plea hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Cash previously posted. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not have contact with the following persons/places:  *Margaret Sosa  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.

Defendant Baldemar Barrientos in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions defendant re: English. 
Defendant indicates he does speak English. 
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant is employed by Superior Healthline.  (Written in English)

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Court reads the complaint. 

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Is not sure if he will hire an attorney.  
Court questions defendant further.  

NOT GUILTY plea entered by the Court on the defendant's behalf. 

BY THE COURT:  $150 cash is continued. 

Atty Knaapen recommends conditions as stated. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.
